Dockerizing Com S 363

Neo4j Docker

About Neo4j

We use Neo4j on Assignment 5 to learn about graph databases. We needed to install it on our computers and run it using the browser. Instead of adding more software on my system, I chose to use a Docker container running Neo4j. The official Neo4j Docker setup guide is very helpful with this.

Their Guide

Organizing The Data To Be Imported

In the assignment we must modify our Neo4j configuration to allow for data to be imported from anywhere. Instead of modifying the configuration, I just copied the data to the import folder that we mapped in the previous step. To do so, copy the given parts folder to neo4j/imports/ Where neo4j is the directory you created in the previous step.

Showing Where The Folder Is

Importing The Data

We were given instructions on how to import the data, but because the data is in a different location, we need to change the instructions. The portion of the command we need to modify: 

LOAD CSV WITH HEADERS FROM 'file:///C:/363SPR2019/parts/parts.csv'


Instead we change it to: 

LOAD CSV WITH HEADERS FROM 'file:///parts/parts.csv'


The other 2 imports need to be modified in the same way.

Doing The Assignment

While doing the assignment we used the Neo4j Browser. To access this, navigate to localhost:7474 and use the editor. There you will write and run your queries.
